meanings.def: not dirty
examples: Are your hands clean?
She wiped all the surfaces clean.
(British English) It is your responsibility to keep the room clean and tidy.
(North American English) Keep your room neat and clean.
I can't find a clean shirt (= one I haven't worn since it was washed).
The hotel was spotlessly (= extremely) clean.
The council does a good job keeping the streets clean.
I scrubbed the floor to get it clean.
Is your room clean and tidy now?
It's almost clean. I just have to wipe the table.
Please leave the kitchen clean.
The bathroom doesn't stay clean for long.
The room smelled clean and fresh.
The whole house was spotlessly clean.
You're supposed to keep your room clean.
He wiped his plate clean with a piece of bread.

meanings.def: having a clean appearance and living in clean conditions
examples: Cats are very clean animals.

meanings.def: free from harmful or unpleasant substances
examples: clean water/air
Thousands were left without food or clean drinking water.
clean energy
We all want a cleaner environment but who is going to pay for it?
cleaner cars (= not producing so many harmful substances)
Electric buses are a clean, environmentally friendly way to travel.
The water was lovely and clean.
Fiscal incentives will be introduced to encourage the use of cleaner cars.

meanings.def: with nothing written on it
examples: a clean sheet of paper

meanings.def: not offensive or referring to sex; not doing anything that is considered bad or wrong
examples: The entertainment was good clean fun for the whole family.
Keep the jokes clean please!
The sport has a very clean image.

meanings.def: not showing or having any record of doing something that is against the law
examples: a clean driving licence/driver’s license
a clean police record

meanings.def: not owning or carrying anything illegal such as drugs or weapons
examples: The police searched her but she was clean.

meanings.def: not having taken drugs or alcohol
examples: He's been clean for three weeks.

meanings.def: played or done in a fair way and within the rules
examples: It was a tough but clean game.

meanings.def: having a smooth edge, surface or shape; simple and regular
examples: A sharp knife makes a clean cut.
a modern design with clean lines and a bright appearance

meanings.def: done with skill and in an accurate way
examples: The plane made a clean take-off.

meanings.def: with no changes or mistakes in it
examples: I do my utmost to produce clean copy, but occasionally a mistake slips in.
It backs up data frequently, keeping a clean copy of your work.

meanings.def: tasting, smelling or looking pleasant and fresh
examples: The wine has a clean taste and a lovely golden colour.

meanings.def: very clean
a report that says somebody is healthy or that something is in good condition
examples: Doctors gave him a clean bill of health after a series of tests and examinations.
The building was given a clean bill of health by the surveyor.

meanings.def: a complete end to any connection with a person, an organization, a way of life, etc.
examples: She wanted to make a clean break with the past.

meanings.def: a break in a bone in one place
a record of your work or behaviour that does not show any mistakes or bad things that you have done
examples: No government operates with a completely clean sheet.
They kept a clean sheet in the match (= no goals were scored against them).

meanings.def: to remove all the people or things from an organization that are thought to be unnecessary or need changing
examples: The new manager made a clean sweep of the department.

meanings.def: to win all the prizes or parts of a game or competition; to win an election completely
examples: China made a clean sweep of the medals in the gymnastics events.
The opinion poll suggests a clean sweep for the Democrats.

meanings.def: to admit and explain something that you have kept as a secret
examples: Isn't it time the government came clean about their plans for education?

meanings.def: to avoid doing anything wrong or illegal
examples: Since leaving prison, he's managed to keep his nose clean.

meanings.def: to tell the truth about something so that you no longer feel guilty
examples: He made a clean breast of everything and admitted taking the money.

meanings.def: to agree to forget about past mistakes or arguments and start again with a relationship
